Don't go to Daemon Tools for their "free version."  Their "free version" is merely a trial offer they can use to advertise themselves with.

Daemon tools lite is legally free from the daemon tools website (http://www.daemon-tools.cc/eng/downloads), but you can however use a serial key if you want to be able to get support. If you haven't bought the product you won't get any support, but you can still use it. When you're going through the setup it will ask you if you want to use a paid license or a free one, just choose the free one. It's perfect for mounting .iso files to install games or watch movies in .iso format or other similar things and formats. If you want to find out more about the difference between the lite, pro and the pro advanced version just head over to their website.
